| PUT         | /users/{userId}    | Update user details          | `{ "name": "", "email": "" }`    | 200 OK, `{updated_user}`           |
| DELETE      | /users/{userId}    | Delete a user                | -                                | 204 No Content                    |

### Projects

| HTTP Method | Endpoint              | Description                 | Request Body                     | Response                          |
|-------------|-----------------------|-----------------------------|--------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| POST        | /projects             | Create a new project         | `{ "name": "", "description": "" }`| 201 Created, `{ "id": "", "name": "" }` |

| GET         | /projects/{projectId} | Get project details          | -                              | 200 OK, `{project}`               |

| DELETE      | /projects/{projectId} | Delete project               | -                              | 204 No Content                  |

### Tasks

| HTTP Method | Endpoint                | Description                   | Request Body                                      | Response                        |

| GET         | /projects/{projectId}/tasks | List all tasks in project     | -                                               | 200 OK, `[ {task}, ... ]`       |
| GET         | /tasks/{taskId}          | Get task details              | -                                               | 200 OK, `{task}`                |
| PUT         | /tasks/{taskId}          | Update task                  | `{ "title": "", "description": "", "assigneeId": "", "status": "", "dueDate": "" }` | 200 OK, `{updated_task}`       |
| DELETE      | /tasks/{taskId}          | Delete task                  | -                                               | 204 No Content                |

### Comments

| HTTP Method | Endpoint               | Description                   | Request Body                  | Response                      |

```json
{
  "error": {
    "code": "RESOURCE_NOT_FOUND",
    "message": "The requested resource does not exist."

}
```

# UI Layout Proposal: Task Management System

---

### 1. Overall Structure

- **Header (Top Bar)**
  - Logo / App Name (left)
  - Global Search (center)
  - User Profile & Settings (right)

- **Sidebar (Left)**
  - Navigation Menu:
    - Dashboard
    - Projects
    - Users (Admin only)
    - Notifications
    - Settings / Logout

- **Main Content Area**
  - Contextual views depending on navigation:
    - Project List / Details
    - Task List / Details
    - User List / Profile

---

### 2. Key Screens and Layout Components

#### A. Dashboard

- Summary cards (count of projects, tasks due soon, overdue tasks)
- Activity Feed (recent comments, task updates)
- Quick actions (create project, create task)

#### B. Projects Screen

- **Projects List View**
  - List/table of projects with columns: Name, Description (truncated), Number of tasks, Last updated
  - Filters & Search bar (filter by name, status)
  - Pagination controls

- **Project Details View**
  - Header with project name, description, edit button
  - Tabs:
    - Tasks
    - Members/Users
  - Tasks Tab: List of tasks tied to the project with columns: Title, Assignee, Status, Due Date, actions (edit, delete)
  - Button to add new task (opens modal or side panel form)

#### C. Tasks Screen

- **Task List View**
  - Filterable/Searchable tasks globally or scoped by project
  - Columns: Title, Project, Assignee, Status, Due Date, Priority (if applicable), actions

- **Task Detail View**
  - Overview pane showing all task info (title, description, status, due date, assignee)
  - Comments section with comment list and add comment input
  - Edit buttons inline or accessible via modal/side panel

#### D. Users Screen (Admin Role)

- User list table: Name, Email, Role, Actions (edit, delete)
- User profile detail with editable fields (name, email)
- Create User form

---

### 3. UI Component Suggestions

- **Responsive Design:** Sidebar collapsible on smaller screens; main content scrolls vertically.
- **Modals or Side Drawers:** For create/edit forms (new task, new project, user edit).
- **Status Indicators:** Use color-coded badges for task status (e.g., Pending, In Progress, Completed).
- **Pagination:** At bottom of lists, with options to select items per page.
- **Breadcrumb:** For navigation hierarchy on project and task detail pages.
- **Loading & Empty States:** Friendly messages and spinner animations.

---

### 4. Example Wireframe (High-Level)

```
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Logo |       Search bar             | User Profile Icon    |
+------------------------------------------------------------+
| Sidebar Menu                   |                           |
| - Dashboard                   |  [Project List or Detail]  |
| - Projects                   |  ------------------------- |
| - Users                       |  | Project Name           | |
| - Notifications              |  | Description            | |
| - Settings/Logout             |  | [Tabs: Tasks, Users]  | |
|                              |  | Task List with filters| |
|                              |  | + Add Task button     | |
+------------------------------+---------------------------+
```

---

### 5. UI Flow Highlights

- Users land on the **Dashboard** after login.
- From Dashboard or Sidebar, users navigate to **Projects**.
- Clicking a project shows **Project Details** with associated tasks.
- Tasks can be created/edited/deleted inline or via modals.
- Each task detail allows commenting to be added/viewed.
- Admins have additional access to **Users** management.
- User profile & session settings accessible via top bar.

---

After reviewing both the backend API design and the frontend UI proposal, here is a consolidated, cohesive recommendation ensuring alignment and smooth integration between frontend and backend components for the Task Management System.

## Consolidated Proposal for Task Management System

### 1. API & UI Alignment Summary

| Feature                        | Backend API                              | Frontend UI                                      | Notes & Recommendations                              |
|-------------------------------|----------------------------------------|-------------------------------------------------|-----------------------------------------------------|
| User Management               | `/users` endpoints with full CRUD      | Users screen with admin-only visibility          | Restrict user management UI/actions based on roles  |
| Project Management            | `/projects` and nested `/projects/{id}/tasks` | Projects list & detail with tabs (Tasks, Users)  | Ensure UI uses pagination & filters matching API    |
| Task Management               | Tasks nested under projects; `/tasks/{taskId}` for detail and update | Task lists (global & project-scoped), detail views with comments | Use API’s flexible update endpoint; UI to support inline editing and status updates |
| Comments                     | `/tasks/{taskId}/comments` and `/comments/{id}` delete | Comments section in task detail view              | Support real-time or near-real-time comment updates |
| Authentication & Authorization| JWT token-based, route protection      | Login flows + protected views                      | Frontend to handle token storage securely & refresh logic if applicable |

---

### 2. Key Improvements & Best Practices

**Pagination & Filtering:**  
- Backend supports pagination on list endpoints (e.g., `/users`, `/projects`, `/tasks`). Frontend UI should expose pagination controls and filters accordingly.  
- Standardize query parameters (e.g., `?page=1&limit=20&search=term&status=completed`) and document for frontend consumption.

**Consistent Error Handling:**  
- API returns uniform error format with `code` and `message`. UI should parse and display user-friendly messages.

**Role-based Access Control (RBAC):**  
- Users can only modify their own or authorized resources; admin-only endpoints guarded. UI conditional rendering for actions like User management.

**Responsive UI & Interaction Flows:**  
- Ensure modals and side panels for create/edit flows are responsive and accessible.  
- Use status badges/colors on tasks matching backend `status` values.  
- Provide seamless feedback on network actions (loading spinners, error toast notifications).

---

### 3. Integration Details

| Area                   | Specific Integration Advice                                |
|------------------------|------------------------------------------------------------|
| User Authentication    | Use `/users` POST for signup, JWT token saved on login; attach token in `Authorization` header for all protected API calls |
| Project Creation       | Call POST `/projects` with `{name, description}`, update UI project list on success |
| Task Lifecycle          |  
- Create: POST `/projects/{projectId}/tasks`  
- Read: GET `/projects/{projectId}/tasks` or `/tasks/{taskId}`  
- Update: PUT `/tasks/{taskId}` with partial or full updates including status changes  
- Delete: DELETE `/tasks/{taskId}`  
| Comments                | Add via POST `/tasks/{taskId}/comments`, delete via DELETE `/comments/{commentId}` |
| Error & Validation      | Implement client-side validation matching backend expectations to reduce errors (e.g., required fields, date formats) |
| Data Sync & State Management | Use optimistic UI updates for better UX; handle API errors gracefully to rollback state |

---

### 4. Suggested Next Steps

- **Write OpenAPI (Swagger) Specification** based on the provided API design to support frontend code generation and API documentation.  
- **Create React Component Hierarchy** aligned with the UI layout to manage state efficiently and simplify integration with backend.  
- **Define Role Management Model** clearly (e.g., admin, user) and integrate into both API and UI visibility/access rules.  
- **Implement API Client Layer** on frontend abstracting all backend calls with JWT token handling and error management.  
- **Set up Testing Plan** covering both API endpoints and UI components—unit tests and integration tests—to ensure reliability.

---

### 5. Summary

This cohesive design and integration plan leverages a RESTful backend API with a clear resource hierarchy and stateless authentication while delivering a responsive, user-friendly frontend UI. The system balances scalability, security, and usability without overcomplication.

If preferred, I can now generate a detailed OpenAPI spec, propose frontend component architecture, or draft sample API client code to accelerate development.

---

Let me know which deliverable to prioritize next or if you want me to start drafting technical documentation or detailed workflows for particular flows!
